017package org.apache.commons.chain.impl;
018
019import static org.junit.jupiter.api.Assertions.assertEquals;
020import static org.junit.jupiter.api.Assertions.assertNotNull;
021import static org.junit.jupiter.api.Assertions.assertNull;
022import static org.junit.jupiter.api.Assertions.assertSame;
023import static org.junit.jupiter.api.Assertions.assertTrue;
024import static org.junit.jupiter.api.Assertions.fail;
025
026import java.util.Iterator;
027
028import org.apache.commons.chain.Catalog;
029import org.apache.commons.chain.CatalogFactory;
030import org.apache.commons.chain.Command;
031import org.apache.commons.chain.Context;
032import org.junit.jupiter.api.AfterEach;
033import org.junit.jupiter.api.BeforeEach;
034import org.junit.jupiter.api.Test;
035
036/**
037 * Test case for the {@code CatalogFactoryBase} class.
038 *
039 * @author Craig R. McClanahan
040 * @version $Revision$ $Date$
041 */
042public class CatalogFactoryBaseTestCase {
043
044    // ---------------------------------------------------- Instance Variables
045
046    /**
047     * The {@link CatalogFactory} instance under test.
048     */
049    protected CatalogFactory<Context> factory = null;
050
051    // -------------------------------------------------- Overall Test Methods
052
053    /**
054     * Set up instance variables required by this test case.
055     */
056    @BeforeEach
057    public void init() {
058        CatalogFactory.clear();
059        factory = CatalogFactory.getInstance();
060    }
061
062    /**
063     * Tear down instance variables required by this test case.
064     */
065    @AfterEach
066    public void tearDown() {
067        factory = null;
068    }
069
070    // ------------------------------------------------ Individual Test Methods
071
072    /**
073     * Test a pristine instance of {@link CatalogFactory}.
074     */
075    @Test
076    public void testPristine() {
077        assertNotNull(factory);
078        assertNull(factory.getCatalog());
079        assertNull(factory.getCatalog("foo"));
080        assertEquals(0, getCatalogCount());
081    }
082
083    /**
084     * Test the default {@link Catalog} instance.
085     */
086    @Test
087    public void testDefaultCatalog() {
088        Catalog<Context> catalog = new CatalogBase<>();
089        factory.setCatalog(catalog);
090        assertTrue(catalog == factory.getCatalog());
091        assertEquals(0, getCatalogCount());
092    }
093
094    /**
095     * Test adding a specifically named {@link Catalog} instance.
096     */
097    @Test
098    public void testSpecificCatalog() {
099        Catalog<Context> catalog = new CatalogBase<>();
100        factory.setCatalog(catalog);
101        catalog = new CatalogBase<>();
102        factory.addCatalog("foo", catalog);
103        assertTrue(catalog == factory.getCatalog("foo"));
104        assertEquals(1, getCatalogCount());
105        factory.addCatalog("foo", new CatalogBase<>());
106        assertEquals(1, getCatalogCount());
107        assertTrue(!(catalog == factory.getCatalog("foo")));
108        CatalogFactory.clear();
109        factory = CatalogFactory.getInstance();
110        assertEquals(0, getCatalogCount());
111    }
112
113    /**
114     * Test {@code getCatalog()} method.
115     */
116    @Test
117    public void testCatalogIdentifier() {
118        Catalog<Context> defaultCatalog = new CatalogBase<>();
119        Command<Context> defaultFoo = new NonDelegatingCommand();
120        defaultCatalog.addCommand("foo", defaultFoo);
121        Command<Context> fallback = new NonDelegatingCommand();
122        defaultCatalog.addCommand("noSuchCatalog:fallback", fallback);
123
124        factory.setCatalog(defaultCatalog);
125
126        Catalog<Context> specificCatalog = new CatalogBase<>();
127        Command<Context> specificFoo = new NonDelegatingCommand();
128        specificCatalog.addCommand("foo", specificFoo);
129        factory.addCatalog("specific", specificCatalog);
130
131        Command<Context> command = factory.getCommand("foo");
132        assertSame(defaultFoo, command);
133
134        command = factory.getCommand("specific:foo");
135        assertSame(specificFoo, command);
136
137        command = factory.getCommand("void");
138        assertNull(command);
139
140        command = factory.getCommand("foo:void");
141        assertNull(command);
142
143        command = factory.getCommand("specific:void");
144        assertNull(command);
145
146        command = factory.getCommand("noSuchCatalog:fallback");
147        assertNull(command);
148
149        try {
150            command = factory.getCommand("multiple:delimiters:reserved");
151            fail("A command ID with more than one delimiter should throw an IllegalArgumentException");
152        }
153        catch (IllegalArgumentException ex) {
154            // expected behavior
155        }
156    }
157
158    // ------------------------------------------------------- Support Methods
159
160    /**
161     * Return the number of {@link Catalog}s defined in our
162     * {@link CatalogFactory}.
163     *
164     * @return the number of {@link Catalog}s
165     */
166    private int getCatalogCount() {
167        Iterator<String> names = factory.getNames();
168        assertNotNull(names);
169        int n = 0;
170        while (names.hasNext()) {
171            names.next();
172            n++;
173        }
174        return n;
175    }
176}
